title: Boosters Won't Make It To Everyone For Now, But Vaccines For Young Children Are Coming
description: The FDA Advisory Committee decided not to approve boosters for people sixteen and up. Instead, they made a recommendation for those 65 and up, or younger people at high risk to get a booster shot right now from Pfizer-Biontech.
copyright: Copyright 2020-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: Boosters Won't Make It To Everyone For Now, But Vaccines For Young Children Are Coming
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: The wider population of Americans will have to continue to wait to get a COVID booster shot. In the meantime, vaccinations for children 5 to 11 are nearly approval.
itunes:subtitle: The wider population of Americans will have to continue to wait to get a COVID booster shot. In the meantime, vaccinations for children 5 to 11 are nearly approval.
content:encoded: The FDA Advisory Committee decided not to approve boosters for people sixteen and up. Instead, they made a recommendation for those 65 and up, or younger people at high risk to get a booster shot right now from Pfizer-Biontech.
